entries.name: Age
entries: Bumains live up to 300 years, they reach adulthood at 30 and their bodies stop aging until the third century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Bumains are driven by strict order, usually making them Lawful

entries.name: Size
entries: Bumains are slender and tall, up to 2m. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Superior Hearing
entries: Bumains take advantage of their massive ears to scan their immediate surroundings. You have Blindsight within 15 feet of you. You also have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Children of the Tree
entries: You are linked to Bumbauch, the sentient tree of your homeland. Having a short or long rest near a big living tree helps you revitalize and remove any exhaustion points left.

entries.name: In Vino Veritas
entries: Any creature that has been drinking alcohol with you regards you as a trusted friend for as long as it remains drunk, unless you deliberately harm it. Additionally, you can never become sick or poisoned from drinking alcohol.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell prestidigitation} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell identify} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell magic mouth} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Durandali.

Both humans and bumains shared the crib as races, being the very first sentient beings to walk the lands. Still, they share little in common. Unlike humans, the bumains wonÂ´t let their emotions override their thoughts, their curiosity is not as passionate as their brethren. And while inspired by progression, the bumain culture would not sacrifice the ecosystem in exchange of goods, in fact, they will adapt their designs according to the natural environment around them.

Their physicality is of a slender version of the human body, greyish blues or greens in tone of skin, their head is long with tiny black bead eyes, yet the most noticeable feature are the ears, holding two massive pointy ears that extend as wide as their head on each side.

entries.name: Life of the Party
entries: Given their proclivity for living in the moment, it can be difficult to get satyrs to follow orders or even stay in one place for any length of time - though in an adventuring party they make up for such flakiness with the entertainment they provide, as well as their unsurpassed skill at gossip and rumor-mongering. Satyrs are very much at home in inns and taverns, sometimes venturing into humanoid settlements (usually in disguise) purely to sample the atmosphere of a particularly famous common room, gaze upon an extremely beautiful person, or taste an especially rich food.

entries.name: Wild at Heart
entries: Although they enjoy the pleasures of humanoid society, a satyr's true home is in the forest, and any visit to civilized lands will ultimately prove fleeting. Enchanted woodlands provide shelter and safety, as well as the companionship of other fey creatures, thus most satyrs make their homes in small, hidden villages. Others are more solitary, retreating to some secluded hermitage to perfect a piece of music or recover after a particularly intense festival.

entries.name: Caprine Appearance
entries: Satyrs have many goat-like aspects, including thick fur on their arms and legs, curling horns on their heads and hooves instead of feet. This makes them easy to identify, for they generally make no attempt to hide these features. A variety of different shades of fur are found among satyrs, with whites and browns being most common. The grooming habits of satyrs are unpredictable, as fey fashions can change rapidly, but the vast majority put at least some effort into looking good at all times.
All Satyrs are male; female goat-legged fey are 'glaistigs', a completely different type of creature.

entries.name: Satyr Names
entries: Though satyrs are given a name by their parents, they also take great pride on any nickname they can earn through their revelry and debauchery.

entries.name: Given Names
entries: Adronus, Avery, Barases, Canteon, Dantes, Gilderos, Grover, Jed, O'Connor, Pan, Phaegan, Puck, Romeus, Silenus, Tarteron, Tum-Tum, Willie

entries.name: Nicknames
entries: Count Tipsy, Fairy-Dance, The Holy Drinker, Horny Devil, Mister Handsome, Ol' Three Sheets, The Roarin' Lord
